content.description: The crux is making it from the ground to the first hand jam.  From here, jam your way to the top.
content.protection: A stopper will protect the opening moves well.  From here, its hand and wide hand sized pieces to the top.  There are no anchors, but you can easily build and anchor or sling some rhodys to get back down.
content.location: From the approach trail, head left toward the obvious splitter crack.

content.description: The name of this block is unknown, but it's the first block that you will see from the approach trail on the left side of the trail.   There's an obvious splitter crack in the center of the face.  This is the line to do on this block, great crack climb!  There are other route options as well, but most of them lack in quality and it is difficult to get back down as the top is extremely dense in vegetation.
